componentInstanceProperties.value: Invest in Sonnant's Pioneering Audio Content Platform

componentInstanceProperties.name: summaryText
componentInstanceProperties.value: Be first in line to access this exclusive deal

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Key Investment Highlights

  • Growth: With 90% growth in 2023 alone, Sonnant is now at A$350K ARR, with a global customer base, plus ad buyer partnerships with Podder and PodcastDB.
  • Customers: Customers include major broadcasting and podcasting companies including SCA, Nine, Nova, Salem Media Group, top podcast hosting platform Libsyn and top podcast Good Life Project.
  • Market Opportunity: Combined radio and podcasting market over $160 billion in 2023 with podcast CAGR of 27.6%. US podcast advertising revenues expected to exceed $4 billion by 2024 with revenue outpacing the total internet ad revenue market (72% vs 35% year-on-year)*
  • Unfair advantage: Significant Trademarks, AI-driven, proprietary IP and ML code copyright plus a platform agnostic integration approach enabling rapid scale.
  • Forecasts: With lead investment from SCA and Startupbootcamp and growth from this funding, Sonnant is forecasting $2m ARR in 2025 and $10m quickly thereafter. Comparative Series A valuations show potential for a 300% uplift for investors in this round.

*sources: Grandview Research & Internet Advertising Bureau

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Overview - What is Sonnant?

When it comes to consumer engagement with media, nothing beats the flexibility and portability of spoken word audio content. The average listening time for spoken word content is 1 hour 34 minutes each day!**

However, the task of producing, managing, marketing and monetising audio content is still largely manual, incredibly time-consuming, and doesn’t fully harness the monetisation potential of the rich data insights in each piece of content. Given the growth in demand for audio content is not slowing down, there’s a massive need to address these inefficiencies.

Enter Sonnant.
Sonnant is a platform that unleashes the untapped potential of audio content to fuel revenue growth and deliver massive efficiencies across the audio publishing lifecycle. From editing to promotions, and ad placement to brand mention tracking, Sonnant automates the time-consuming tasks producers love to hate and makes it easier for advertisers and media alike to gain unparalleled ROI from audio content.

Sonnant’s technology leverages the power of AI and machine learning combined with a user-friendly UI and powerful APIs to enable integration with podcasting hosting platforms and other tools, making it highly scalable. In the future, the company envisions enabling the Adwords of audio across a multitude of platforms.

With this potential in mind, a stellar team at the helm and international customers like Southern Cross Austereo (SCA), Nova, Salem Media Group, Libsyn, Podder and PodcastDB under their belt, Sonnant is ready to further develop its product and scale in a combined radio and podcast market worth over $160 billion in 2023.**

**source: emarketer.com

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: Sonnant Clients Include:

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
The Offer

Sonnant is offering investors a SAFE note which is convertible at a 10% discount or USD $11 million market cap (whichever is better) in their next priced round.

This investment opportunity is open to wholesale and pre-approved investors, and you can invest from $5000.


Invest now

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Problem & Market

Audio publishers are lagging behind other media in digitising their workflows and they’re struggling to maximise the monetisation potential of their valuable inventory (ie. their content).

Sonnant currently addresses 4 big industry-wide pain points audio publishers face, enabling them to transition from analogue-era workflows to digital efficiency so they can maximise revenue from their content assets.

The key challenges are:

  • Streamlining manual workflows to reduce inefficiencies and costs.
  • Empowering publishers with capabilities to unlock the full value of their audio content assets.
  • Enabling contextual targeting to increase advertising spend and yields.
  • Providing comprehensive sales data and inventory insights to enhance advertiser spend and sales opportunities.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
The Sonnant Solution

Sonnant is a cloud-based enterprise platform, accessible via a browser UI and APIs. It turns audio into structured, actionable data to automate workflows and provide specialist metadata for advertising/monetisation and promotion/engagement.

Sonnant works by turning audio into text, and then using various, industry-specific AI models (including natural language processing) to index this text in a meaningful way. These include:

  • Tagging – incl. people, places, organisations, locations
  • Categorising – incl. advertising category, brand safety level, speakers
  • Automating – incl. placing ad markers, creating clips, writing summaries, turning broadcast into podcasts, defining chapters and more

With this indexed and structured data, for any size content library, Sonnant enables publishers to understand and attain the true revenue potential for every piece of content created. Because audio remains a labour-intensive endeavour, especially with promotion and sales, Sonnant’s data science team has built and trained models to automate workflows that are relevant for every publisher in the industry.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Unfair Advantage

What sets Sonnant apart in the market is its unrivalled depth of portable data and the ability to deliver an unparalleled return on investment for its customers. This publisher data can be augmented with any other data source to create a breadth of possibilities. Sonnant’s independent and centralised content library is future-proof for its customers. It unifies 3rd party solutions, new AI models and attribution data, no matter what app, platform or supplier a publisher chooses to work with.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Intellectual Property

Sonnant holds registered trademarks over the names Sonnant® and Voice Intellect®, the domain names sonnant.com and sonnant.ai, copyright over the code that underpins Sonnant’s ML processing, as well as proprietary processes, relationships and know-how which are protected as trade secrets.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
The audio publishing market globally, which includes broadcast, radio and podcasts is enormous with a solid CAGR:

  • Global Radio Market - $143 BN in 2023
  • Global Podcast Market - $18.52 BN with CAGR 27.6%
  • 43,773 radio stations globally producing 65.5 million hours of annual audio
  • 5 million podcasts globally with 70 million episodes
  • 73% or 209 million people in the USA listen to audio monthly

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Traction

In 2023 to date (as of 7 November),  Sonnant grew recurring revenue by 90%, currently at A$324K (US$227K) ARR, including key achievements:

  • First major US customer, Salem Media
  • First major UK customer, AdTonos
  • 130% NRR on Southern Cross Austereo renewal
  • Partnerships with Podder and PodcastDB to develop an offering for ad buyers
  • Other new customers, including True Native Media, ARN, Wildcast and Libysn

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Growth Strategy

The key focus in the next few quarters is on sales (ramping up US and closing ANZ deals) and customer success for customer acquisition and retention. In parallel, the team have identified opportunities within these customers that require product development to facilitate more frictionless customer acquisition.

  • Sales and Adoption — Bring on Scott Herd full-time (US Sales), and hire a customer success manager to ensure the company signs new customers, onboards these customers successfully and grows its annual spend.
  • Product development — Includes platform/partner/channel integrations & API enhancements, AI models based on customer use cases to retain a competitive advantage and UI/UX enhancement.
  • Operations — Continue to optimise operations that support the platform infrastructure and improve processes as the company scales to reduce unit costs.

In parallel, the team growth will enable the CEO to continue to advance a revenue share model for monetising unsold/under-utilised inventory, in partnership with demand (advertiser) side providers.

Capital Required

To fund their growth plan, Sonnant is raising US$2m. The company’s notable existing investors include SCA (ASX:SXL) and Startupbootcamp as well as a number of high-net-worth experienced angel investors.

Valuation Today & Valuation Uplift

The valuation will be based on the terms agreed with the lead investor,  and the cap is set to reflect indicative discussions with VC funds and guidance from the market from recent seed stage raises by startups with comparable revenue and growth characteristics (ie pre-money valuation of ~US$9m).  The discount offers investors further upside for this early commitment.

The funding will provide Sonnant with approximately 24 months of runway with a forecast of US$2m ARR by the end of the period (late 2025). At that point, Sonnant expects to raise Series A funding to scale the business further and progress to profitability.

Recent median Series A valuations have been in the $40-$50m range, which would reflect an uplift in excess of 300% for investors in this round.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Exit Strategy

Within 5 years we forecast the business will be generating annual revenue greater than $10 million from publishers and advertisers across all major English-speaking markets (North America, UK, ANZ) and possibly other languages.

At that stage, depending on market and industry conditions,  Sonnant may explore:

  • a trade sale to or merger with another industry player. M&A activity has been common in the audio industry with multiple acquisitions by Amazon, iHeartMedia, Sirius Media/SXM, Audacy, and other large enterprises, as well as vertical SaaS specialists (i.e. Constellation Software).
  • a growth capital round, which would facilitate a sale of existing shareholders’ interests to a larger institutional investor who wishes to further grow the business before pursuing a merger, acquisition or IPO.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Why Invest Through VentureCrowd?

VentureCrowd is the leading digital investment platform for alternative assets. We’re here to prove investments can be accessible and impactful. With rigorous curation and due diligence as our backbone, our success track record speaks for itself:

  • Only digital investment platform in Australia to have successfully delivered multiple exit returns to investors through equity crowdfunding

  • 74K+ members and counting

  • 30M+ distributed to investors, and

  • Over $312,000,000 in capital raised since inception

VentureCrowd is investor-led, so we only list deals with secured external lead investors. Our investors then invest on the same economic terms as professional investors. If you invest in one of our deals, you will receive equity or ownership in the company that is raising the capital. Not only might your investment come with lower fees and capital commitments, but it will also come with reduced deal complexity, and you’ll have access to alternative equity, property and credit opportunities on the same terms as professional lead investors.

Invest now

If you would prefer to speak to one of our team members about this offer, please:

  • Book a call or

  • call us on 1300 039 655

Please note, the Fund Manager reserves the right to vary or cancel the Offer, vary the amount raised under the Offer, vary or waive the Minimum Investment and close the Offer, without notice and without giving reasons.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Fees

Investors invest through a VentureCrowd Trust, which VentureCrowd manages as a single asset. We charge an annual management fee to investors, payable on exit and we only charge a performance fee where an exit delivers profit, thereby aligning ourselves with investor outcomes.

  • Contribution Fee: 1.1% This is the fee charged by the Trustee for the establishment of the Trust and the purchasing entity, structuring the overall investment and raising capital by way of issue of Units. Payable upon acceptance of your investment by the Trustee.
  • Management Fee: 1.65% per annum (charged on conversion or exit).
  • Performance Fee: 20% of the profit. We only charge a performance fee on conversion or exit.
  • Off-Market Transfer Fee (if you wish to transfer your holding to someone else): $500 + 2% of the total amount transferred, unless the buyer is identified by you in advance
